title: A Wake-Up Call We Can't Ignore
content:
“Jesus is coming like a thief in the night.”

That’s what many people say — and because of it, they believe nothing can really be known about when He’s returning. But here’s what most overlook: Jesus was not talking to believers when He gave that warning.

The apostle Paul clears up the confusion in 1 Thessalonians 5:4, writing to the church:

> “But you, brothers and sisters, are not in darkness, so that this day should surprise you like a thief.”

Why not? Because true believers have the Holy Spirit living in them — the Spirit who opens our eyes to understand Scripture and recognize the season of His return. No, we don’t know the exact day or hour. But we’re not meant to be clueless. We’re meant to be awake.

---

**God's Character Demands a Warning**

God never pours out judgment without warning first. It’s part of His nature.

He warned the people of Noah’s time — for 120 years. He warned Sodom through Abraham. He sent Jonah to Nineveh and Nahum later. Why? Because as 2 Peter 3:9 says, “God is not willing that any should perish.”

He is patient. But His patience is not forever.

Right now, that same God is once again warning the world. He’s calling people to repentance. And He’s doing it because His Son is coming — not as a suffering servant this time, but as a conquering King.

---

**Two Messages — One for Unbelievers, One for the Church**

For the unbeliever:
> “Flee from the wrath to come by running into the arms of Jesus today.”

For the believer:
> “The night is almost gone; the day is at hand. So let us lay aside the deeds of darkness and put on the armor of light.” — Romans 13:12

This is not the time for lukewarm faith. Not the time for spiritual laziness. If there was ever a time to take your walk seriously — it’s now.

---

**The Six Great Signposts of Jesus’ Return**

The Bible doesn’t leave us guessing. It gives us sign after sign to know when the time is near. These aren’t vague. They’re specific — and many have already happened or are happening right now. Let’s walk through the six main categories of signs, like markers on a road pointing straight to the return of Christ.

1. **Nature’s Voice Is Getting Louder**
Jesus told us in Matthew 24:7 and Luke 21:11 to expect more earthquakes, famines, plagues, and strange signs in the skies.

These things have always happened. But Jesus said they would increase — like birth pains. Stronger. Closer together. More intense.

From floods and wildfires to deadly viruses and massive storms, creation itself seems to be groaning — just as Romans 8:22 said it would.

And all throughout Scripture, God has used natural events to get people’s attention. He did it in Noah’s day. In Egypt. Through the prophets. Even at the crucifixion of Jesus. And He’s doing it again.

2. **Society Is Spiraling**
Jesus said it will be like the days of Noah — godless, immoral, and indifferent.

Paul, in 2 Timothy 3, takes it further:
People will love only themselves.
They’ll love money.
They’ll chase pleasure.
They’ll despise truth.
They'll act religious, but reject real power.

We’re watching this happen daily — globally.

3. **The Spiritual Landscape Is Split in Two**
Two movements are rising side by side.

One is dark:
- False teachers
- Spiritual deception
- Occult practices
- Hatred toward Christians and truth

The other is light:
- The Gospel spreading to all nations
- Church growth in Iran, China, Africa
- The Holy Spirit moving through dreams and visions

As light grows, darkness grows bolder. Neutrality is disappearing.

4. **Technology Has Finally Caught Up**
Prophecies that once didn’t make sense now do.

How could the world watch two dead bodies in Jerusalem? Easy — smartphones, livestreams.

How could someone control global commerce with a “mark”? Digital IDs, implants, central bank digital currencies are here.

The Tribulation wasn’t possible before. Now it is.

5. **Politics Are Lining Up With Prophecy**
The Bible describes:
- Israel reborn and hated (1948)
- Russia from the north
- China from the east
- Hostile Arab neighbors
- A revived Roman Empire

Wars, tension, instability — all aligning with prophecy.

6. **Israel: The Prophetic Time Clock**
No sign matters more than Israel.

1948: Israel becomes a nation — Isaiah 66:8 fulfilled.
1967: Jerusalem reclaimed.

Jesus said, “When you see the fig tree bloom…” that generation won’t pass before the rest is fulfilled.

These are God’s time markers.

---

**What It All Means**

The world isn’t falling apart. It’s falling into place — just as God said it would. The signs aren’t to scare us, but to prepare us.

If Jesus came back today, would you be ready?
Would He be your Blessed Hope… or your Holy Terror?

If you’ve never surrendered your life to Him, now is the time.

---

**And For Believers… A Final Challenge**

Are you living like Jesus could come at any moment?
Are you walking in holiness? Sharing the Gospel? Praying for the lost?

Can you say like Paul:
> “I have fought the good fight, I have finished the race, I have kept the faith... and now there is in store for me the crown of righteousness, which the Lord will award to all who long for His appearing.” — 2 Timothy 4:7-8

Jesus is coming soon. The signs are clear. The time is short.

Let’s live like we believe it.
